column3: The first letter of the English and of many other alphabets.
A registry mark given by underwriters (as at Lloyd's) to ships in first-class condition. Inferior grades are indicated by A 2 and A.
Stealing cattle on a large scale.
A table or tray strewn with sand anciently used for drawing and calculating and etc.
To cast or drive out or to banish or to expel or to reject.
doing something; being busy or lively.
Water; -- a word much used in pharmacy and the old chemistry in various signification; determined by the word or words annexed.
Hidden; secret. [Obs.] 'The arcane part of divine wisdom.' Berkeley.
A person skilled in the art of building; one who understands architecture; or makes it his occupation to form plans and designs of buildings; and to superintend the artificers employed.
To rub or mark with chalk.
The sovereign prince of Tartary; -- now usually written khan.
To reside in or occupy a chamber or chambers.
